document.masterDocTitle: The enigmatic Nearctic genus Ceramphis Casey revisited (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The enigmatic Nearctic genus Ceramphis Casey revisited (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Lectotype (designated by O’Keefe (1997)) : USA ( California ):
♀ , six labels: “Cal.” [white, print- ed], “S. / deformatus / Horn” [white, handwritten], “ Ceramphis / det W.Suter ‘77” [white with black margins, hand- written], “ LectoTYPE / 3029” [red, printed and handwritten], “ Lectotype ♀ / CERAMPHIS / DEFORMATA / Horn / S. O’Keefe Des. ” [red, handwritten], “ MCZ TYPE / 34844 ” [red, handwritten] ( MCZ )
.
Paralectotypes
(3 exx.): ♂ , three labels: “HornColl / H 1848” [white, printed and handwritten], “ MCZ Type / 34844” [red, handwritten], “ Ceramphis / deformatus H. / det. H.Franz ” [white, handwritten and printed]
;
♀ , three labels: “ Cal ” [white, printed], Para-Type / 3029” [bluish, printed and handwritten], “ Ceramphis / deformatus Horn / det. H.Franz ” [white, hand- written and printed]
;
1 ex. of unknown sex (partly disarticulated), three labels: “Cal” [white, printed], “HornColl / H 1848” [white, printed and handwritten], “ MCZ Type / 34844” [red, handwritten] (all paralectotypes in MCZ )
.
Diagnosis. As for genus; vide supra .
Description. Body of male ( Fig. 1 ) stout, strongly convex, uniformly dark brown; setae distinctly lighter than cuticle; BL 1.75 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–3.
Ceramphis deformata
, male paralectotype. Dorsal habitus (1); head in anterior view (2); left antennomeres 2–8 in dorsal view (3). Abbreviations: atp, anterior tentorial pit; a3–8; antennomere 3–8; cl, clypeus; fr, frons.

subSubSection.paragraph: Tentorium (not shown; studied in semi-transparent temporary mount in glycerol) with dorsal tentorial arms fused with dorsal wall of head.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 4–6.
Ceramphis deformata
, male paralectotype. Head, pronotum and elytral base in dorsal view (4); head and prot- horax in ventral view (5); head and prothorax in lateral view (6). Abbreviations: bst, basisternal region of prosyternum; hr, hy- pomeral ridge; hy, hypomeron; mn, mentum; nss, motosternal suture; pcc, procoxal cavity; pff, profurcal fovea; pgs, postgenal setae; smn, submentum.

subSubSection.paragraph: Elytra together somewhat rhomboidal, conspicuously short and broad, broadest distinctly in front of middle, with base much broader than posterior pronotal margin; EL 0.95 mm , EW 0.88 mm , EI 1.09; humeral calli distinct; basal margin of each elytron concave near middle and lacking basal foveae Punctures on elytra indistinct; setae sparse, moderately long, erect.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–14.
Ceramphis deformata
, male paralectotype (7–13) and female lectotype (14). Mouthparts in anterior view (7); pterothorax and abdomen in ventral view (8); elytral apex and propygidium in dorsal view (9); aedeagus in dorsal (10, 12) and lateral (11, 13) views; labels of lectotype (14). Abbreviations: aest3, metanepisternum; cl, clypeus; lbr, labrum; mg, median groove; msff, mesofurcal fovea; msvp, mesoventral process; mtvp, metaventral proces; pat, pre-apical tooth; pcr, procoxal rest; pm, paramere; pmcc, postmesocoxal carina; pr, prepectus; pst, prostheca; s3–8, sternites 3–8; tf, trichial field.

subSubSection.paragraph: Hind wings long and functional in both sexes.

Legs long; pro- and mesocoxae ovoid, metacoxae transverse and flat, with proximal regions asetose and short posterior articulating projections densely covered with setae; pro- and mesotrochanters short, subtriangular, metatro- chanters strongly elongate, ~2.5 as long as broad, slightly broadening distad, all trochantero-femoral articulations strongly oblique; all femora weakly, gradually clavate; all tibiae straight or nearly so, slightly and gradually broad- ening distad; tarsi subcylindrical, pentamerous, in males not broadened and lacking spatulate setae.

Aedeagus ( Figs 10–13 ) strongly elongate; AeL 0.38 mm ; median lobe with ostium situated dorsally; broad para- meres fused with median lobe and their distal portions fused together and forming ventral aedeagal wall and apex; endophallus with elongate tubular structures; endophallic retractor attached to diaphragm situated sub-basally and lacking lentiform sclerotization.
Spermatheca globular (illustrated by O’Keefe (1997) , figs 9a, c).
